1610227365_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
> [whotoldyouthat](#comment_2_1AeFu4C63ou5WLJuMboxp9Ni2z45eT5XmN): Far right sucks, so does far left. Difference is everyone knows the far right is a joke, literally nobody takes them seriously. The idea of there being a superior race has been destroyed thoroughly.Not near as many regard the far left as being a joke or dangerous. The ideas are more palatable, who wouldn't want more "equality" or even "equity"???! Unless you're very wealthy AND greedy as shit, you probably believe there needs to be as much equal opportunity as possible, possibly even more equitable outcomes. The problems start to arise when figuring out the details of how exactly things are made more equal. Ultimately it's just people doing the equalizing, and they'll need lots of power to do so. Unless the people doing so are perfectly honest, fair, etc the outcomes actually become more unfair than they start as, basically because power corrupts. Maybe if there was some way to ensure the ones making decisions to equalize all the outcomes were verifiably transparent every step of the way we could have true "equity"...Even if that's the way it's portrayed, how does the average Joe verify that things are truly transparent, instead of just appearing so? Can you really trust the "experts" to tell you the truth? I think that's at the heart of the divide right now, can you trust a story/narrative simply because it's told on all the legacy media? Can you trust a narrative simply because it's told by the guy you like aka Trump? Or just because all the new media, like on LBRY/Odysee, agree? IS ANYONE able to be trusted? If so, WHY?

No one can be trusted besides friends and family. Fuck, even that's being eroded for a thousand dollars a pop to list off people you know and saw at the Capitol protest. Far-anything sucks an iron rod. Republicans and Democrats are the same thing. I personally think it'd be cool if the left populist and right populist just agree to work out these fags running office right now. At least that's what I'd settle for.
